channel.title: Client
channel.description: If I want other people to come check out my server, can I just give them the client? Or Do I have to go through the whole jar making and signing process?

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:

“the only way to secure your files is to delete them” - nobody

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:7, topic:524747”]Yes, and make sure to tell them to change or download jdk.

DO NOT INCLUDE THE COMPILER JUST THE RUN[/quote]
Okay its set on jdk 1.7.0_25 I think thats the latest… I will tell them tyvm.

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @yuk yuk
item.description:
@yuk wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:524747”]You can do either.
IF you give them your client, don’t include the java files. You only need the class files to run it. If you give them the java files they can edit and compile them, making it possible that they can hack and cheat on your server.[/quote]
So just take the class files from my client and run.bat? And put it in a file then give it to them?

Read full topic

IF you give them your client, don’t include the java files. You only need the class files to run it. If you give them the java files they can edit and compile them, making it possible that they can hack and cheat on your server.[/quote]cause I can totally not decompile the class file(s) <3.

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You can do either.
IF you give them your client, don’t include the java files. You only need the class files to run it. If you give them the java files they can edit and compile them, making it possible that they can hack and cheat on your server.
